reviews.text: Sengaen garden is a very pleasant place for hot summer days.  Its location by Sakurajima Bay overlooking the volcano creates magnificent views.  It is a classic Japanese garden with lots of streams, ponds and small waterfalls, over which predatory dragonflies circle and exotic butterflies fly.  Many types of trees, plants, places where you can sit and enjoy the surrounding beautiful and peaceful nature.  We were in the garden on a weekday, in the afternoon, and there weren't many people there.  We enjoyed it.  Be sure to include this place in your itinerary when visiting Kagoshima.

A view that you will not forget in your life time. Although this is my second visit to the royal garden, still takes my breathe away. I really like the angle looking out from the lord's bedroom. Japanese zen garden with the volcano as background setting. You don't get that everyday. You cannot get sick waking up to this view in your life.

Gardens and house of the family who ruled Kagoshima for more that 800 years and married into the royal family and shogunate. A beautiful look location with views of Sakurajima and connected to a glass making business which you can tour for free. It is accessible by bus which runs every half hour and has a taxi stand that seems to have taxis until about an hour before closing. One of the better things to do in the area, would recommend.

The Mog Champ sends his regards.

This was my first morning of bring in Kagoshima, and I went on the Kagoshima City bus to make my way here to Sengan-en. The garden is very large and scenic, perfect for a sunny day of walking around!

The best part about this garden is that you can have a small hike to a scenic point where you can see Sakurajima clearly! (well, depends on the weather I guess) it was a bit of an ascent though.

I spent around a full hour walking around this garden, reading around and taking some photos. You can also have a few snacks here since they also sell souvenirs and food too!

Overall this is a beautiful garden that everyone visiting Kagoshima should visit and walk around especially if the weather is good. It's relatively easy to access and cheap to enter as well!

Mogliest Regards,
Your Mog Champ

One of the most touristic places in Kagoshima. A must, you shouldn't miss it. It has a museum, a very elegant glass store and the gardens are beautiful. Also offers a very good place for the perfect photo of Sakurajima Vulcan.🌋

There’s no other language at all display except Japanese, one may need a translation APP to understand the description. I found it interesting as I studied Japanese history especially Meiji restoration in middle school.

Museum focusing on Satsuma and Kagoshima’s pivotal role in unifying and modernising Japan in the second half of the 19th century. If you have 1-2 hours to kill and are nearby, then good for a short visit for ¥300. English explanations are limited and if available of a bad translation software quality. The quirky but of certain interest shows though have a few simultaneous English headphones available.

A wonderful museum!! The displays are really well done. If you understand Japanese, you might spent 90 minutes here.
♿️👁️🦻Accessibility: Be warned the animatronic theater show has strobe lights to mimic lightning. The English narration might also be a bit hard for some people to hear, as the headphones' volume was not adjustable.
👩🏻Female Inclusion- they have some displays about women important to the time period. It's possible they were added later as most of the hard displays are about men, but at least they have them.
🌐English: 7/10:
•English pamphlets.
•The animatronic theater performance has an entire English narration! When you buy your ticket, they'll ask you if you want the English (I was speaking Japanese, but she said there's lots of Kagoshima Dialect in the performance, so I decided on the English; I'm happy I did). The theater has specific seats with headphones plugged into the English feed.
•The interactive museum displays, although super cool, don't have much English.
•There are some outdated English terms, such as "civilization," used here and there.

Amazing museum!! Absolutely go there if you are in Kagoshima. I learned so much about the history of the city. It's very interactive and well made. There are also multiple shows/movies during the day. I ended up being able to see 2 of them during my time in the museum, and they were amazing. Kids and adults will all enjoy!

Hands down one of the best and most enjoyable museums I have been to in a while! If you are interested in Japanese history then you should really visit this place. I was reading and watching almost all exhibits and it took me 3 hours. I had a wonderful time. A few times a day there are also short performances about politics at that time and about students who were sent to the UK to study abroad and learn foreign science to help and develop Japan. The staff provided headphones with English audio (Chinese and Korean also available). Make sure not to miss those stories!
There are also fun "hands on" corners,including one where you can try and compare your strength with Saigo Takamori or hear the local dialects, etc.

Been to a few aquarium in Japan. This one is not as big but it’s definitely the least crowded. You can enjoy the aquarium in peace. They also play a nice soothing music which makes it very relaxing.

There’s a viewing deck at the higher floor to view Sakurajima.

Remember to check out the dolphin show time at ground floor on the right side of the souvenir shop.

The dolphin pool is connected to the public waterway outside the aquarium so you can see them playing there as well.

The aquariums that we have had the opportunity to visit - across Japan - are always beautiful and very well thought out.  The aquarium in Kagoshima is one of the smaller ones and therefore less visited, so you can see everything very well and in peace, especially if you come 1.5 - 1 hour before closing time.  We stopped at the aquarium on the way from Sakurajima and were almost alone there.  Clear glasses allow you to take beautiful photos.

The best dolphin show aquarium so far! The dolphins here have access to swim back into the bay area to enjoy wild life. I guess this makes them happier and smarter. The resting area has a significant window view of Sakura Island volcano. Good place to visit for a family trip.

So happy we came just in time to watch the dolphin show! I absolutely loved it!! Maybe the aquarium is not that big but it has a nice vibe, and it is immaculately clean so that the glass looks invisible. It was a very pleasant experience. I'd go there again just for dolphins ^^

A great experience that features myriad fauna of the ocean surrounding Kagoshima, among others.

The main attraction was the whale shark exhibit, which is a large tank containing one whale shark and many other fishes like lemon sharks, mackerels, yellow fin tuna, guitar sharks, and others that I couldn't remember off the list at the side of the tank stating the names of each animal inside the tank.

There are many other exhibits as well, such as corals, anemones, jellyfish, juvenile sea turtles, all in their respective enclosures. Other exhibits include animals of mangrove swamps like the electric eel and mudskippers. There are also seals and dolphins, the latter of which are also presented by a dolphin show which occurs a few times each day.

All in all a pretty cool experience. There are souvenirs at the end of the experience could be purchased, albeit rather expensive (some more than the cost of the ticket to enter itself).

I like how this park feels! It's aged, but it's an interesting place for a short visit. The dinosaurs are beaten up a bit, but they are fun to see. Also, you get a really nice view of the volcano! The road leading up to the park is curvy, so be careful. If you have children, they would certainly love this place!
This place is so eerie and awesome. Pretty much had the whole park to myself. Cool stuff to look at, and leads to a great view.
Best Theme Park in Kagoshima, huge dinosaurs and exciting slide. Must visit!
Went when it was raining, but it was still pretty cool. Can walk from the ferry drop off spot to get here. Josh Briel wasn't on his phone at all because of the rain, really made the trip for me

It's a challenge to access without a vehicle due to the incline of the road. We came here almost 20 years ago and it is mostly the same. The roller slide will hurt/massage you unless you can master balancing on your feet going down. Has a great view of Sakurajima and a good shelter if it any rocks start falling. A nice place for kids to play and picnic.
enjoy the cherry blossoms in this park. Beatiful ☺️

Free entrance. Located top of a hill, in the southern part of Kagoshima city. it's a famous scenic park with a rose garden and hiking courses. Uphill, you can view Mount Sakurajima. Downhill, you can view Hirakawa zoology park and listen to various howlings, barkings and cryings of our relatives of the other species.
It's a beautiful park with an excellent rose flower garden.
Sakura blooming here
Full 🌕 of Comfort, scenery!

Nice place of recreation, either for young couples or for families with kids. You have to walk a few kilometers through the zoological garden, which makes you a good exercise. It's educational, as you may learn about many rare animals such as Koalas, Urautan, Penguins etc. It's relaxing as you quit from daily mundane human world and meet the nature of animal world.
It was cool when we got there, and clean also. Time well spent. Got some funny moments with the animals that you can see in the pics
This is a fantastic zoo for the price point, it is well maintained and got a good selection of animals. I hope there would be more visitors!

Very impressive zoo especially considering it's so cheap! Lots of amazing animals you could see up close due to the many windows. You walk one route and you see all the animals following this route. It made it very easy to enjoy. Highly recommend going here! It was a bit difficult to get there via public transport but it was doable.

The weather was very nice. It was rainy in July but just we just have one nice weather day, and we decided to go to the zoo.

The zoo is huge, at the hill side, so you should expect walking up and down slopes. Old people and children may be a bit tired visiting there. But it worths a lot. The zoo contains various kinds of animals with spacious living environment, and kept in very good condition. I expect everyone could enjoy very good time there.

I forgot the entrance fee but it is very cheap. Souvenirs are cute and we bought a bit. Sadly it also means the zoo may not be earning money, and some parts of it are not in good condition, etc. the polar bear's pool is dry out. I hope I could donate some money to make animals living in a even better place.

Please visit and make them earn :)
A beautiful open area at the sea front, next to several ferry terminals. Great place to relax, some exercise, and see the volcano.

This is a great place to relax and enjoy an afternoon. The park offers a great view of both Sakurajima and the city of Kagoshima. There are large open areas for playing baseball or walking your dog. The area is beautifully decorated with azaleas and has an interesting fountain and sculptures. There are also restroom facilities and vending machines. However, there are no trash cans, as is typical in Japan.
I had a picnic there and man was the veiw insane. Sakurajima never looked so close. You could see the volcano so clearly from that area. It was such a calm place to just relax at.

This park could be so much better given the location and excellent views of Sakurajima volcano island. The lay-out and set-up is very simple and barren. Instead of a walkway connecting in a straight line with Kagoshima’s main avenue towards the seafront, you are forced to walk around a car park first. Still highly recommended for your first views of Sakurajima upon arriving in Kagoshima.
Waterfront park next to the cruise ship terminal and view of the volcano. All good with views of the  city, too!

Beautiful park with lots of flowers, plants and interesting trees. It was my first time to visit here today, but I fell in love with it. So many things to explore here, so if you are coming with family and kids, you definitely won’t be bored for the whole day! Highly recommended!
Absolutely stunning flower garden. Didn’t expect too much but was very surprised when I realized how big the garden was. Definitely try to plan in 2-3 hours to enjoy the peaceful garden.

Amazing place to stroll through all kinds of flowers and trees! There are also places to  just sit and relax, or for children to play. The grounds are huge though, so in order to see it all, allow for three hours. If you are in a hurry or are not that good on foot, carts can be rented that you can drive through the park.

This place is a beautiful, relaxing place to visit!  There is a bus that stops infront that will take you into Ibusuki City.  I had a wonderful time walking around taking photos of the flowers and soaking in the tropical weather and talking to the friendly people who work there.  There is a butterfly garden that you can walk through that is heaven!  Make sure and buy a Ibusuki Cider the drink while you explore the gardens!  It is so delicious!!
Beautiful flower park. It's so large that you can spend an afternoon just walking around and admiring the garden.

data.formatted_address: 1834 Kasarichō Ōaza Setta, Amami, Kagoshima 894-0504, Japan
data.name: Kagoshima Prefecture Amami Park

reviews.text: Good place yo visit, well located near Airport.
It's beautiful, and there is a stunning spa here
The shape of the building is wonderful. The inside is more wonderful.
Waste of tax payers money
Shimauta (local songs) are available to hear.

data.name: 平川動物公園 遊園地

reviews.text: There is no admission fee for the amusement park, it is located inside the zoo. Roughly 100 yen per person per ride. Although the variety of vehicles was limited, the children seemed to have fun. Ferris wheel, merry-go-round, trapeze, rotating airplane, and go-karts. Go-karts are 100 yen for parents and children, so it's a good deal.

A zoo with a history of 50 years.
I headed straight down the main road and felt a very tropical atmosphere.
The park is spacious and a really good exercise!
I was grateful for the signposts along the way.

You can also have a picnic like in a big park ◎
An object that tells you the time as soon as you enter the entrance? Something like this will greet you.
There is also a footbath, so you can take a break if you feel tired.
I felt that it was rare to see multiple animals in the same area.
Of course you can also see Sakurajima.

Please be prepared to be physically exhausted.

It's spacious and easy to see. A panoramic view of Sakurajima. There are many cafeterias, snack stores, and shops scattered throughout the area.
There are plenty of squares and benches where you can have a picnic.
Although the amusement park is not large, it is fun enough for toddlers and early elementary school students.
Although there were some rides that could not be used due to the influence of Corona, it was a place that you could enjoy normally (2020.10.14)

It was great to be able to spend a day at the zoo and half day at the amusement park.
The prices are low and it's a perfect place for families.

Free parking and free admission to a lovely park overlooking Sakurajima. It's famous for seasonal flowers and was stunning during cherry blossom season. I can understand why so many people were camped out for ohanami parties. Would love to visit during another season.
The visitor’s area, next to the bathrooms, had a cool exhibit with pictures of local plants and birds. For the birds, if you scan a QR code below the photo, you can hear their calls! So neat and fun for kids and adults.
Massive park with lots of space for picnics! Food options on site are limited so suggest you BYO. Lots of sunscreen too…!

This park is very unfriendly public park. Thais park doesn’t have any sight seeing bus inside the park for the people who have disabilities for walking. The only option is the wheelchair. This park has sharp slopes and so hard to push the wheelchair for my mother. It’s extremely disappointing.
very large park, fresh air!  One of the most beautiful flower viewing places
One of the best places to get a beautiful view of the Sakurajima. The park is really spacious and people can just roam freely. The park is a very relaxing place, it feels out of this world.

data.name: Sakurajima Volcanic Shore Park and Footbath

reviews.text: We went on a rainy day. Mt Sakurajima was barely visible. Bring a towel if you intend to soak your feet in the warm onsen water. The cats are friendly, you can pick up one (if it chose you) and let it sleep in your lap while you soak your feet.

Bring a towel!!!
We came to the footbath towards the later end of the day and it was quite empty.
We had a lot of fun just soaking our tired feet and watching the volcano go off in the distance.
There are tons of cute cats roaming nearby.

Took a footbath after visiting the observatory, the water comes from an underground hot spring. Even when it's a hot day the atmosphere and the view to Sakurajima is great. It's very quiet (meaning no crowds at all), also it's fun to watch the ferries go back and forth while relaxing. This park is a joyful place for a lengthy break.
Warm spring water foot spa located in a park overlooking the sea. There is a visitors centre here and it is near to the ferry terminal. A good place to give your feet a rest.

My husband and I loved this foot bath after our bike ride up the volcano!  It’s very simple — you just take off your shoes and socks, sit down, and slide your feet into the warm water.  So refreshing after a ride!
Beautiful park, with an ancient built stone bridge. There is an exhibition center explaining the history of this place.
Small park with two old bridges. It does look strange having fake rivers go under the bridges though. This place also has kids equipment so would be good for a picnic.

Nice little park. I honestly don't know what it's all about, what the 'memorial' part is or even if the bridge is authentic, but it's a great easy access park to take the kiddos to and hang out. Don't know where the river water comes from but it was cool and refreshing on the summer day I went.

Beautiful bridges and museum

We used one-day tram pass to go to this place. Though the weather was very hot, there was a small pond for kids and adults to play in water.
The museum also explained us how the bridge was built through a 5-min short video.
Although there were not many foreign tourists getting off on this spot. If having time, it's a good choice.
very nice, access via city view bus, 20 min walk from sakurajima ferry or 15 min walk from kagoshima station (end of both tram lines)

data.name: 平川動物公園 遊園地 ゴーカート

reviews.text: It's a mystery who it's for. MUGIUDA BASE is more enjoyable for adults and children than going here.

It looks like a park with a beach attached.
The lawn is also well-maintained, making it a fun place to have a picnic with your kids.
The toilets flush well and have Western-style toilet seats, and there's also a parking lot, so it's probably a hidden gem for a park.
Even in winter, Kagoshima is warm and comfortable~☀️

Driving clockwise around Sakurajima from Sakurajima Ferry Station, you will find that there are fewer attractions in the north and east, so there are fewer tourists. When we came here, we were the only ones. The park environment is well organized, and the scenery towards the seaside is vast. , this quiet and exclusive situation is really great!

I think I stopped for a bathroom break.
Nothing special, but
Because the sea is very close
The view is nice.

On a business trip from Tokyo, I took a bicycle trip around Sakurajima by ferry from Kagoshima Prefecture😁
I brought a lunch box, so I had it at this park 😊
There was no one there, but there was a toilet, so I guess the locals use it for camping. That's the atmosphere 😊

Amazing Cruises Ship port 🛳️⛴️🚢
1 Chuokoshinmachi, Kagoshima, 890-0076, Japan

Clean port indeed! There are English maps that they are handling out on the information. We also had a chance to bump some highschoolers who sells matcha mochi and were so nice! I think they are also filming it for their local tv station. I’d say there was a language barrier at first but some of the students speak good English so when they ask us to try, we did not hesitate to do so!

We didn’t try to take cab going to attractions (even though we carry 2 big luggage), as there were long lines coming from Cruise passengers. We walked from Port to the nearest JR line (going to Chuo Station), it took us a good 1 hr & 10 mins on walk.

A good view of steaming Sakurajima and beautiful flowers!
Beautiful well kept port/terminal with lots of open space. A great place to relax, exercise, picnic, etc.
If arriving by sea then there is a magical view of the volcano. There is a neat little park as you get off the ship. Lots of happy people walking their dogs. Lovely terminal and Port.
It was a perfect location for our cruise ship with transportation right outside the port. We had a good day with a good information center in the terminal.

What a gorgeous view on volcano and city! Going up may be a bit of a physical effort but the way is not that long. The forest is quiet and peaceful. Plenty of benches and vending machines with drinks. Also there is a lil nice shop on the top where we bought a few cool souvenirs and an ice cream.

Family trip to a beautiful view.  If you're going to spend time in Kagoshima on a hot summer day, this viewpoint is a good tip.  You can get to the top by city bus, but you can also stretch your body and legs by climbing a lot of stairs.  Like we did.  The view of the city and Sakurajima is breathtaking, and above all, we can walk through the huge cool park and spend quiet moments under the crowns of mature trees.

Beautiful view, definitely worth the hike up! There were two wonderful volunteers at the observation deck, providing information to visitors and helping to take photos. I want to especially thank them for their service!

Beautiful views of Sakurajima volcano with an easy climb. We approached from the steep steps access from the below residential area however you can drive up and park. There are toilets. Also you should be aware(not afraid) if you walk on down through the park there have been pit vipers spotted however the paths are large and a snake would be easily avoided

View is amazing. Got a clear view of the city and Sakurajima. Best time to view is just before sunset. The sun is setting from the other direction so don’t expect to see long sunset. There’s a few friendly stray cats to play with.
Just visited here in a warm day in this winter. My kids enjoyed playing with a grass sledge (need to buy). You will see the wonderful view of Sakura-Jima there as well
One of the best places for family quality time. All family member will have fun in the way that is best for him, or her.
Large pleasent part currently undergoing major works
Very nice place for kids to play, for walking, many other activities
Great park with a big, safe play area.
The nature is strangely beautiful, soak in the hot springs and then continue walking around.
Unfortunately, there was no water on this day, but it was a rough depression that refused to be approached.

Sakurajima may not have a pond, but this is a lucky spot where a lava pond appears depending on the tide.
#play Sakurajima
#playkagoshima

It's said to be a pond made of lava, but frankly speaking, it doesn't really look like a pond since it's right next to the ocean.
From here there is a promenade along the coast.
Depending on the tide, you'll be lucky if you can see it!

My husband and I had a wonderful time riding up the bike path along the road to the observatory.  Imagine our excitement when we realized that they were holding a bike race on the road while we were there!  It was so much fun to watch the racers in the shadow of the volcano!

Nice scenic observation deck for a good break during your tour to Sakurajima. There is a toilet and water cooler here as well. There are alot of clingy cats that will follow you and invade your personal space, so this may not be the best stop for those who have a fear of cats. I was trying to escape from the cats and did not manage to take a photo of the scenery.

If you come with the tourist bus, you will have about 5 minutes to enjoy the nice view of Sakurajima at this observation deck.

The bus will stop for 5 minutes or so. You just go enjoy the view and come back to the same bus. If you don't want to come back to the same bus, I suggest you to tell the driver about that.

At this spot, there are some restrooms you can use.

A stop for most tourists. The place was “created” by the lava that was erupted many years again. There was a tiny island being buried underneath. Once you walk up the “observatory” you can see Sakurajima in one side and the whole panorama view of Kagoshima across the water.
It’s a good place to view the Sakurajima, but you also get the same kind of views by walking along the road if you’re not in a hurry
Nice ferry ride from Kagoshima.   Scenic bus ride from ferry.   Volcano showing some activity.   Nice views towards Kagoshima
It's an active volcano
It was beautiful sightseeing 😌

Nearest station: 10 minutes walk from Kagoshima Station, about 10 minutes by ferry
The ferry costs 200 yen and runs 24 hours a day.

The Sakurajima volcano has repeatedly occurred since recorded history. There are many records of eruptions, and the area is still active. The mountain that stands out in the middle of the sea is particularly distinctive and is one of the symbols of Kagoshima. That's what I mean.

I don't know because I went there without doing much research, but I think it's better to go by car.
If you go on foot, there don't seem to be many buses, so it takes a while to get around on foot, but I was surprised to find that ferries run 24 hours a day, which is convenient for tourists, and there are quite a few. (There was one every 20 minutes) It was cloudy on the day I visited, but was it volcanic smoke? I couldn't really see the mountain itself.

I went around Sakurajima
I wanted to stop at the roadside station in front of the ferry terminal, but had to give up due to traffic.
If you are a traveler who is not in a hurry, why not buy some souvenirs at the roadside station?

Due to the dust, we recommend wearing a mask.
The car is rough

water vapor? I was excited to see it come out.

On the way back, I bought some souvenirs at the black vinegar shop after leaving Sakurajima.

data.name: かごしまカヤックス 集合場所

reviews.text: My partner and I had an amazing time kayaking around Sukurajima with Ura 😊 Ura was brilliant and answered all of our questions about the landscape and wildlife surrounding the volcano, he was a brilliant guide and made the trip even more enjoyable! We would highly recommend this activity if you're in Kagoshima and Sukurajima! 🛶🌋

We had a great time kayaking on Sakurajima. This was a very special and amazing experience. You can see and touch stones floating in the sea, which can only be seen near the volcano and while kayaking (not visible from the beach). I highly recommend it to all visitors, especially those new to kayaking. We are beginners and following Ms. Manami's guidance, we had no difficulty kayaking. Thank you for showing us this amazing view of Sakurajima.
Wonderful experience! Manami & Ura were so kind. It was a fun experience, my husband I would highly recommend booking a kayaking tour with this company.
It was very fun, the views were beautiful and it was nice to learn a little more about the volcanic coast of Sakurajima.  My only complaint is that I wish I had booked a longer tour!
This is a very interesting journey. The view is very beautiful. We are very happy. Thanks for the instructor Manami!

This is a really great place to experience nature. The sakura trees were blooming when we went. We fed the ducks and swans, then went into the visitor center. The visitor center is really interesting. It has a lot of fish tanks and displays set up so you can see the various fish, turtles, and frogs. There is also boat rental and bicycle rental if you want to go on the water or ride around the pond.

Very easy walk up to the peak, which takes you about 15 to 20 minutes max. and can be done also with smaller kids. The view is stunning! And of course, don't forget to bring your bento for a nice picknick.

Free from tourists in winter when we visited, but with the cherry trees, should be a hot in spring. There's a beautify 4-km walk around the lake. If one has a whole day, one should try the longer trail up several hills.
Love this place and the climb. Will definitely go back. Amazing beautiful nature
Such an amazing lake! You may also appreciate the sakura in late March.

A great place to look at Kagoshima-Shi from height.  If you want to enjoy the night sense of the city, you must consider the return route because some branches route do not provide sufficient lighting.
Great views
Very good to visit - more and more place to get a good view over the city and the volcano - free to visit
Lovely views over the city... Walk to the top was pretty quick.
nice views of the city and Sakurajima volcano mountain

This place is amazingly pure natural scenery. It's an active volcano with constant / daily eruptions. You can't go too close to the summit mouth but can still get the feeling.
You can get there by city ferry runs every 30 min from Kagoshima ferry port.
In the island there is a hop-on hop-off tour bus taking you to all the spots.
There is also natural hot spring foot bath to enjoy after some walk/hike.
There are not much option of excursion on the island, a few convenient store and couple small restaurants.
The nature is so relaxing and pure.
There is no smell or smoke or sounds expected. Per nice 360 to city / pier views.
Could make easily a fine half day trip out of it.

This volcano is a true highlight of Kagoshima. It's one of the most active in Japan, so you might even see smoke puffing out the top!  The island itself is a neat mix of classic Japanese town and volcanic landscape, creating a really unique atmosphere. There are lots of cool things to see and do here, making it a great place to spend a trip.

Kagoshima is a beautiful place and I'm sorry I didn't get up early enough to take the ferry over to the island/volcano,  we saw it when coming in with the ship it was quite eerie and yet breath taking at the same time I'm sure we'll be back
But on another note I did get Godzilla at the Aeon store

Wonderful quaint volcanic island filled with nature trails. Away from the hectic city life. Nice place to recharge. For cat lovers, you will find cats all around the island waiting to come to you for food (no feeding thou! to prevent illness spreading). Purchase the Kagoshima Cute pass to fully enjoy the island!
Beautiful place to spend for a day. One-day CUTE pass can be used to take the ferry and  city view bus on the island and Kagoshima city.

data.name: Reimeikan - Kagoshima History Museum and Fine Arts Center

reviews.text:
What an excellent surprise visiting this place was. The building itself seems austere and this trend continues inside. However the actual museum contents are so detailed and beautifully presented that it far exceeded my initial expectations.  I cannot recommend it highly enough for the presentation of the historical significance of the region and for the very welcoming and helpful staff.

The cafe at the museum is also lovely, with a pleasant view of the courtyard and plenty of light. Staff there too are excellent and there are a small number of well-curated pieces on sale which you can peruse while you wait for your tea and cake. And do have the cakes, they are delicious.

One of the best history museums I have been to that is dedicated to the story of Kagoshima for the past 5000 years. They have English translations of key signs and artifacts and are on the grounds of an old castle for which the gate and walls still stand. We spent over 2 hours and felt we had to jump over some parts. Full of artifacts and knowledge.

3 hours is still not enough.
Best Museum in town, you can see through all of the history of Kagoshima. In the other way, how japan become the greatest of Asia.

Large and expansive museum which goes into a bit too much detail about local history. It has strong English, Korean and Chinese translations. Costs 400 yen to enter or 300 with one of the local bus passes. Some photography is allowed but most of the time no
This place has loads of motion sensors on the floor that light up displays as you walk past. The cave inside was well built.
This viewpoint was further away from the station.  There were fewer visitors.  The shelter area was large enough.  Taking pictures with the volcano background was very easy.  Carpark was free.
If you have never visited an active volcano up (relatively)close, this is a good spot. Be ready for some dust and ash on your shoes, possibly on your pants if you sit on any bench or surface,
A clear view of the mountain although it was a cloudy day. The trees and sea in the area provide a nice view.
Lots of parking. Clean toilets and great views. Very easy walking paths
Well-maintained paths and even wheelchair accessible areas with many shelters. The views depend on the weather.

Wasn’t sure how to rate to be honest. It’s not bad that’s for sure. It’s small, provincial and OK. The gallery itself on the second floor is small but well presented. When we visited there was an exhibition of local

Wonderful ciry museum with several bluechips in their permanent collection, including; a Picasso, Monet, Matisse and several Kandiskys. Lots of Historical works, local crafts and contemporary Japanese art.

2 exhibitions on. 1 was permanent collection of western and local art.
Small cafe with nice coffee and chiffon cake.

It's small, but well its cheap and super chill and you still get to see famous artist paintings like monet and picaso alongside japanese paintings.
When I visited there's an audrey hapburn photo exhibition on the 1st floor (the normal museum stuff is on the 2nd floor btw). There's also a cafe and souvenir store.

Costs 300 yen to enter and has a large number of minor works by major painters. It's almost like someone had a shopping list saying I want a Monet, check. How about a Warhol or Picasso, check. If you have a bus pass it's 240 yen to enter

data.formatted_address: 1025 Sakurajimayokoyamacho, 桜島小池町 Kagoshima, 891-1418, Japan
data.name: Yunohira Observation Deck

reviews.text:
The Mog Champ sends his regards.

You can get here by the island bus if you don't have a car. I think it's the only observation deck worth visiting, it's simple and it doesn't have much but it's the closest view you can get of the volcano and I think that's neat! Best to time it with the bus schedules if you don't have a car as well!

Thanks for the observation deck Kagoshima!

Mogliest Regards,
Your Mog Champ

This is one of the best spots for those who want to take a photo with the Sakurajima crater using public transport. There is a label mentioning Sakurajima, and the building provides detailed information about the crater. Inside the building, there is a small shop selling drinks and souvenirs.

i’ve seen a lot of volcanos in my life and sakurajima was nothing substantial—up close that is. to me it looked much cooler and impressive from a distance (including at the foot bath by the visitor centre). maybe it was due to the cloudy weather as well that we didn’t get the best view, but anyway.

we got on the very last bus from the visitor centre at 4:36pm—very early, to my utter dismay—and it waited at yunohira observation deck for 10 minutes before heading back down. in my opinion that was plenty of time to look at the views and take pictures. at 5pm though the shops in the building were already closed.

the full bus tour takes around 1 hour and there is an english audio guide too explaining how the volcano was formed and such. i would only suggest coming up here by bus if you have the time, the weather is good, and the volcano is spewing fumes. otherwise, the view from below is plenty good enough (and you’ll save money too).
There was a small building in the viewpoint, which allowed a better view from the staircase and upper floor.  The volcano was very clear.  Carpark was free.
Best and cloest observation point to view the volcano. It's becoming a must go place for all visitors coming to Sakurajima.

Awesome display of artefacts, models and documents of the Shimadzu family, their contributions to the modernization of industrial Japan. Also, it shared on the overall transformation of Japan during the Meiji Restoration
Not very interesting museum. You can not take photos inside, and there are mostly cardboards explaining some historical facts.
A small, but really interesting museum on the importance of lessons in the formation of modern Japan.
The main building was closed so there was only a small exhibition.
Beautiful gardens with a good view of the volcano.
It's small but free! Actually has some really interesting stuff inside, mostly the natural flora of Kagoshima. I wish there was a bit more English, but I can't complain for the price!
It is free of charge...A nice place for family with children to learn about the environment, the nature.  There are snakes, frogs and many insect specimens.

Small museum which is free to enter. It would be better to call this a Natural history museum and also note that there are few translations apart from Latin names for animals. Is good for a wet day though

It's free so it is nice please to see when you are visiting Kagoshima. They don't have any informations in English here though.
As a foreign visitor you get a gift = volcanic sand from Sakurajima 😊

Don’t miss this museum because of its old-fashioned appearance ！！！Though free of charge, it is curated superbly inside. All information in aspects of geography, biology and science about Kagoshima are well integrated into this mini space with much interactive funs. Even the toilet cap opens automatically when you come close to it.

data.name: Kagoshima City Hometown Archaeological History Museum

reviews.text:
Events are also held within the facility.
It feels good to walk outside.
In the fountain, the 300kg stone rotates with just water, which is amazing. However, the water was...dirty.
It looked like he was going crazy in the square.

Here we experienced making magatama necklaces and plates. Even the youngest aged 5 to 48 had a great time concentrating and enjoying themselves.
Next time I want to go make wind chimes ✨
There are many other experiences like starting a fire, so it's a place you can enjoy over and over again. There are free movies and at the exit of the history museum, you can wear the clothes of ancient people and take pictures. It's also recommended if you're having trouble finding a place to take your kids on a rainy day.

You can see and even touch a lot of earthenware that was excavated in Kagoshima Prefecture.

Various types of unique pottery developed in the early Jomon period in southern Kyushu are on display.

Why are there so few users? You came here at a low time.
2019/03/16 Cherry blossoms are in full bloom. It's one big tree. Is it wild cherry blossoms?
2019/03/26 The cherry blossoms in the park behind the main shrine of Taniyama Shrine were almost here.

I go there often.
The temporary exhibitions are fun, but children can also enjoy the permanent exhibitions and free spaces.
They often hold events, and it's convenient to be able to make reservations without getting too crowded.
There are toilets for children, and they can use them together, which is great for families with children.

The location is a bit inconvenient however the view is spectacular. It is a relatively small museum but has some great artworks and historical artifacts. I think due to the location the museum barely had any others visitors while we were there so it was an interesting experience.

This art museum is located on a hill and has a wonderful location overlooking Sakurajima.  It is a long walk uphill from the nearest bus stop, so unless you take a taxi from Kagoshima Chuo Station, you will be sweaty and unable to appreciate it.  We have everything from artists from Kagoshima and pottery from Kagoshima to art from around the world.  The annual event that brings together creators from Kagoshima is very popular.
Best view of the volcano only 10 mins taxi from the main train station about 1000yen well worth it just for the view very nice grounds also had a good walk around.
Beautifully positioned Musium. You can watch the magnificent view of downtown kagoshima in front of mighty Sakurajima.

A difficult place to find, with no bus service close by. If you like sculpture, it is worth the walk. It is a Saturday and there are only 5 visitors, so also a great place to decompress while viewing some fine art

I went there with my 5 years old child. We watched a short movie about extinction of dinosaurs. There was exhibition of dinosaurs' skeleton and other body parts at that time. Had a pleasant time there. Recommended for elementary school students.
Good for children, but it will be better if having English notes.
Great science museum for kids.
Great place for kids to play and learn about science.

There were exhibits about Kagoshima's nature, science and technology, and space.
The facility includes a planetarium, video hall, laboratory, and more, making it a facility that can be enjoyed by both children and adults. In the planetarium, you can experience the mysteries of the universe by projecting images of starry skies and space travel. In the video hall, documentary films about science are shown, and in the laboratory, you can conduct experiments on electricity, magnetism, chemistry, etc.
The science museum also holds various events and lectures. In the summer, stargazing sessions and special planetarium programs are held, and in the winter, science lectures are held.
I think it is a facility that is aimed at children but can also be enjoyed by adults (2024.05.26)

This place is perfect if you want to learn all about Sakurajima's history. They have tons of cool exhibits and displays that make everything super easy to understand. It's a must-visit for anyone wanting the inside scoop on the island. Plus, they have a souvenir shop and even sell ice cream.

Visitor center. Staff is nice and willing to help. Unfortunately most displays inside are in Japanese only.

It is interesting to know that there is a World Biggest White Radish 1 to 1 replica inside. It's up to 31kg!!

The volunteer staff here are very nice. There's lots of great information here aboit past eruptions. The short movie in the theater  is subtitled in English and worth a watch to understand how the surrounding area lives with an active volcano.
Nice place to start the Lava trail. When you come back, you can soak your feet in the onsen with great views

Nice visitor center. Try to come here first...it gives you some history and volcano facts, there is also a 30m movie you can watch (with English subtitles). Also it show you what's around the area. Plus you can get a nice footbath here! A small shop inside had some nice things too.
Good place!

This is a quiet art museum deep in the mountains.
The approach to the facility is a bamboo forest, and you can hear the chirping of birds and the murmuring of the river, making it recommended for those who love nature.
The inside of the museum was also very quiet and I was able to enjoy the works in peace.
We had a wonderful time and were provided with coffee and tea.
It is about a 5 minute walk from the parking lot to the facility.
Please be careful on rainy days as it is a gravel road.

I didn't go inside the museum, but I went there when it was open, in early December. There were no people around in the morning, so I had the autumn leaves all to myself. It might have been even more beautiful if we arrived a little earlier in time for the autumn leaves season. Because it is in the mountains, the air is clear and there is no noise at all, making it a truly different space.

I visited the Kodama Museum of Art for the first time in several decades, which I often visited when I was a student.
Bamboo forests are no different, and I really like museums that make use of nature.
The number of works that have been expanded and displayed has increased considerably, making it very worth seeing.The blue of the sky and the white of the clouds can be seen in the stream flowing under the atrium and the hexagon above, and the way they are reflected in the glass is another work of art. I could stare at it for a while.
It was a meaningful time to have some coffee and relax.
There is one thing that I really liked when I learned 30 years ago that the bamboo forest path that you can see from the window to the museum is a piece of art, but that was the only thing I was disappointed about this time.

2020/09 Today I came to appreciate nature, not art works.
The bamboo forest was beautiful and had a great atmosphere.
At this time of year, spider lilies were in full bloom.
Cherry blossoms, plums, maples, etc. can be enjoyed in every season.

Worth visiting even for foreigners to learn about the history of kamikaze “Tokkō” pilots who sacrificed their lives in world war two.

I would also recommend visiting Bansei Peace Memorial Museum, which also memorises Tokkō pilots but has different exhibits. Only half an hour drive from this museum.

Makes one wish there will be no war again, but sadly there are wars ongoing in some parts of the world.

When the US landed on Okinawa during World War II, the Japanese Army and Navy carried out crazy strategic suicide attacks. Young soldiers of the Army flew off from their base in Chiran to Okinawa, never to return. The last messages the suicide squad members left for their families are preserved here. Each message is a cry from the soul, conveying the horror of war education. It's impossible to see without crying, but it's a facility that should be seen at least once.

Beautiful museum within the last Kamikaze base in Japan. We attended a remembrance ceremony. Many letters from the young pilots and so much emotion through the entire place. Far from the city and far from regular tourist spots, it is an excellent experience if you have time to spend a couple of hours there.
Very touching museum. Some things were in English but you get the understanding. You can only take photos in a couple of areas inside the museum.

The absolute best museum in all of Japan. This is a truly humbling place to visit thats priced perfectly for what via given. This museum should be at the top of any tourists list, well before Hiroshima and Nagasaki because of its humbling nature. I’ve visited every museum in all of Japan and this one bests them all. Make sure to bring tissues when you visit!

data.formatted_address: 6340-220 Koba, Yusui, Aira District, Kagoshima 899-6201, Japan
data.name: Kirishima Open Air Museum

reviews.text:
As of February 2024, there are 23 large art installments in the Kirishima Open Air Museum. It was a fun two hours or so trying to find all the art pieces. Especially trying to look for the eight black dogs. (Was only able to find up to 5.) There are also other installments without numbers that are interesting as well and are shown on the map.
Most of the artwork seems to have been placed in 1999 or 2000, so they are over 20 years old…with that being said, they are being kept nice and clean. The newest piece was placed in 2012, so we could be expecting more pieces to be added in the future.

Lovely art park with a lot of outdoor installations. The indoor exhibition area is rather small. There is also a cafe restaurant at the entrance area. Good for a 1 hour stay if you are around the area.
Quite different than other art museum. Worth to have more people visit it

Located on top of Kirishima National Park is this fantastic museum dedicated to great contemporary art. You need a car to get there or take a tour but worth the trip. Just 320yen to enter. The exhibition hall has exhibits that rotate and outside has grand installations. It was raining when I visited but I will definitely return. The whole area of Kirishima is worth spending a lot of time.
Interesting collection of works and beautiful grounds! English guide booklets are available when you get your tickets. Definitely recommended.

The few photos I took cover an area along the river dedicated to some history of the Meiji Restoration and Saigo Takamori...and that's about all I know of that. There was lots to read and see, everything was so nice and well maintained. It was hot so the shade and water were a nice bonus. 2023
Aside historical significance not much else to see or do, unless you want to sit on the bench in this very small park.
Very little to commemorate the birth of the brave and noble samurai.
Large statue surrounded by a pretty garden
memorable

data.name: 鹿児島市島津忠義公像

reviews.text:
The little walking trail behind the museum is loaded with historic stuff. Bring extra beer and snacks, there are plenty of places to rest
while you explore.

A trip around the place where Saigo Takamori died

Enter the park from the entrance of Tanshoen and it will appear right in front of you.

Tadayoshi Shimazu was the 12th lord of the Satsuma domain, and he expanded the Shuseikan business by building Japan's first textile factory. After the Meiji Restoration, he willingly restored his land ownership and became governor of the Kagoshima domain, and then a member of the House of Peers.

This statue was created by Fumio Asakura in 1919.

The following is an excerpt from the Kagoshima Prefecture Tourism Federation homepage.

Tadayoshi Shimazu, also known as Mochihisa, was the last lord of the Satsuma domain.
His father is Hisamitsu Shimazu.
He succeeded Nariakira Shimazu and became the lord of the domain at the age of 19.
Immediately after taking office, his grandfather, Nariaki, and after his death, his father, Hisamitsu, guided him as the father of the nation.
In 1867, when the secret edict to overthrow the Shogunate came down, he led 3,000 soldiers to Tokyo.
The fact that the lord of the domain himself was present at important points during the grand edict of the Restoration of the Royal Empire, the Small Gosho Conference, and the subsequent Battles of Toba and Fushimi.
In a political situation that could easily turn to the shogunate's advantage,
It can be said that it represents a strong stance not to follow in the footsteps of the Satsuma clan.
The bronze statue is in Western clothing, but it is said that she did not cut her topknot throughout her life, following her father Hisamitsu's orders.

It was a pretty tall statue! Kagoshima is dotted with statues like this! I am once again impressed by the fact that this is an amazing prefecture that has given birth to so many wonderful historical figures! I would like to see some improvements here too! Grass can grow as much as you like! If you put a lot of thought into making it, you can't move it, so I hope you manage it properly! May all the best be with the Osada Hashubi!
The Shimazu Tadayoshi bull elephant passing by on the way to Shiroyama Observation Deck

“Saigodon” was interesting. Tadayoshi Shimazu was the 29th head of the Shimazu family and the last lord of the domain. Born as the eldest son of Hisamitsu Shimazu, he became the lord of the domain in December 1858 according to Nariakira Shimazu's will.

data.name: Seinan War Satsuma Army Headquarter Ruins

reviews.text: This is the site of the last headquarters of the Satsuma army during the Seinan War and is located beyond Shiroyama Park Don Plaza. It's a little difficult to understand. Saigo-don, who was defeated in the decisive battle over Nobeoka-Wada, disbanded the Satsuma army, burned the military uniform of the country's only army general, and broke through Mt. Kaidake, heading for his hometown of Kagoshima and setting up his headquarters here. At this time, the strength of both armies in the Shiroyama confrontation was 300 for the Satsuma army and 50,000 for the government army.The reason they dared to fight a battle that they had no chance of winning was because of the new government's introduction of the four-people equality system. The dissatisfaction of the samurai class may have been taken with them to the afterlife. . . It is said that. In fact, no major rebellion among the samurai class occurred after this. The monolithic image of Saigo Don, the brave generals and other members of the Satsuma army, and the deceased Nao, who are peacefully resting in the Nanshu Cemetery, warms my heart. There are many things to see around Saigodon's final resting place, Saigodon Cave, private school ruins, Tsurumaru Castle ruins, and the surrounding area. Please come and see us.

It took less than 20 minutes on foot from the Tsurumaru Castle Ruins.
You can see Sakurajima beautifully from the observation deck along the way.
It's a spectacular view.
A small clearing in the forest, apart from the statue, some power generators (are they still from Saigo's army??) and mosquitoes, there isn't much to see.
Deep in the ドン square, there are no signboards. You need to use your RPG spirit to find the stairs at the entrance. There is something like an electric tower next to it.
It's a little bit uphill from Don Square, but it's hard to find because there's no signage.

data.name: Rural life experience park in Hirata.

reviews.text:
It was so beautiful! There are so many hydrangeas blooming all over the front page, is this free? It was really beautiful!
I also went to a hydrangea garden for a fee, but this one is definitely bigger and more beautiful!
There were still a lot of small hydrangeas, so I think they will become even more beautiful year after year.
When I went from the Taniyama direction using Google Navigation, I was guided down a very narrow mountain road and wondered if I was really going to a place like this. It was so deep in the mountains that I thought.
There were some cars parked at the bottom of the slope, but there is also a free parking lot at the top of the slope.
If you go up the slope from the parking lot, you will find the first entrance and the second entrance. You can either go from the top or from the bottom, so I think it's best to go whichever you prefer. The park is large and planted on the slope of a mountain, so the slopes are continuous and some are quite steep, so we recommend borrowing the wooden sticks provided at the entrance.
There was a sign saying Hydrangea on the Slope, so I went there, and although the slope was steep, I was able to see the spectacular view from the top! Please do go.
I will go again next year!

I visited the hydrangea garden on the hill for the first time around 3pm on a weekday.
There is a signboard for the parking lot, but it's a little hard to find the entrance to the park after you park your car, and there are a few people who get lost.
If you go up the road between the first parking lot and the second parking lot, you will find a hydrangea garden divided into two parts.

To get to the Daiichi Hydrangea Garden, you can climb up a mountain path with hydrangeas from the bottom, and from the top you can also see the hydrangeas blooming in the distance.
At the second hydrangea garden, as you go up the concrete slope, you can see many hydrangeas blooming in close clusters on a flat surface.
You can enjoy each hydrangea in a different way, but if you're afraid of slipping on mountain trails, I thought you'd have enough fun just climbing up the concrete slope and looking at the second hydrangea garden.
We could see about 10,000 hydrangeas of various colors, and white and pink hydrangeas were rare.

It takes about an hour and a half to see the whole place. It's spacious!
Stroll around as if you were climbing a mountain. We recommend wearing non-slip shoes and comfortable clothing.
There were also no chairs or toilets to be found along the way.

Google Maps only shows "Hirata no Satoyama", but when you go to Hirata no Satoyama, there is a sign nearby that says "Hydrangea Garden on the Hill", so just follow the sign and you will get there. .
*There is no signal near the hydrangea garden! !
If you are not confident about the route, it is better to check the return route first.
Near the hydrangea garden, there are roads that make it difficult for even light vehicles to separate from each other, and I saw several trucks and other vehicles passing by even before 3pm on weekdays, so please be sure to leave yourself plenty of time. Please wear it when you go.

I heard that it was open to the public this year, so I went to check it out. The road to get there is so narrow that only one vehicle can pass along the way, and there are some mountain roads with no guardrails, so it might be a bit scary for large vehicles. However, once we got close, the road was open and the parking lot was spacious.
There are few places where you can see so many hydrangeas for free! There were many hydrangeas that grew taller than adults, and it was worth seeing☺️I was able to take many photos under the blue sky😊Maybe because there was little rain this year, there were some hydrangeas that were already starting to wither.
Shoes are better than sandals as most of the time you will be climbing uphill❗️
If I had to say one thing, I would like them to charge a fee and build a restroom😅

There are apparently 10,000 hydrangeas planted there, and you can admire the colorful hydrangeas everywhere. Recommended as a spot to go out in June. I'm worried because the road to my destination is narrow, but as I get closer, I see a sign that says ``Hydrangea Garden on the Slope''. Please note that on Google Maps it is labeled as ``Hirata Satoyama''.

The 10,000 hydrangeas in the grove carved out of the mountain were a sight to behold.
The view from the top of the hill is amazing!
There are many hills, so wear clothes that are comfortable for walking.
Nice walking trail that follows the coastline. Beautiful views on the Kagoshima Bay. The weather could be very hot even in the first week of November.

The best feeling of relaxation

Soothed by a friendly cat,
Relax in the footbath in the park,
The sea of ​​Kagoshima will soothe you!

Lava is everywhere,
It's fun.

It's about a 20 minute walk from the ferry terminal.

There are very few people.
Are there local elderly people in the park? were gathering.

This is a wonderful promenade.
The course is basically along the coast, and the road surface is red from beginning to end.
It is decorated.
The beginning is flat, and you can see the ocean on your right.
There are only tourists at this early stage, so from this point onwards, you're completely alone.
There are small ups and downs in the middle, but there is more shade from the trees and it feels nice.
At the end of the trail, there is a gentle climb up to the Torishima Observation Deck, but it's not a big climb. The sea is hidden behind trees and cannot be seen much.
There are haiku monuments erected here and there along the way, so those interested should stop by.
The distance was 2.98km one way starting from Rainbow Beach (measured with a GPS watch).
If you start from the visitor center, it is 2.49km one way (see photo).
It took about 32 minutes round trip by running, so it would probably take less than an hour if I walked.
The area near the finish line, Torishima Observation Deck, was originally a remote island, but it seems that sometime after an eruption it became connected to land.
There are explanatory notes on the site about the eruption and the vegetation that followed, so be sure to walk or run all the way to Torishima Observation Deck.

The violent power of the lava flow can be clearly seen. The information board has faded and the information written on it has faded. As is the case everywhere on Sakurajima, the volcanic ash fall discolors many things, turning them hazy and gray.

If you go down to the beach, you can pick up pumice stones. Colorful. The specific gravity also varies. This is a good teaching material that allows you to infer the generation process. If you look for a homogeneous one, you can also use it to remove dead skin!
A pleasant walk at where you could hear autumn coming.
Really nice park for going for a walk, but if you have difficulties with stairs it can be a challenge
Lovely area with a perfect setting for hanami.

Although I visited from outside the prefecture, I enjoyed the promenade and the local ``somen'' noodles.
The weather was very nice and hot, but there was a river flowing a little further down from the parking lot.
It was a pleasant first experience with a cool breeze blowing through the trees.
If you go with a navigation system, you may end up passing by, or get nervous at a sharp turn.
There are many places where you can make U-turns without rushing, so I think you should just take your time and enjoy it.
You can stop by for the first time without making any reservations.

If you make a reservation at Hydrangea or Furusato Archeology and History Museum, you can also make magatama beads.
In autumn, cosmos are also blooming.
Why not go and see it once?
Beautiful park near to Sakurajima ferry terminal. You can get a marvellous view of Sakurajima and the sea from the hill.
Nice park with lots of greenery and two old bridges as a major feature.
Short Park but very beautiful tree

It is a well-maintained park with a bronze statue of Marshal Togo and a cemetery.
There was an area where cherry blossoms were planted. It looks like it will be busy during the cherry blossom viewing season.
Tofukuji Castle, an ancient mountain castle, is located further back. Izumi - Tofukuji Castle - Shimizu Castle - Naishiro - Tsurumaru Castle, and is said to be the castle that served as the stepping stone for the Shimazu clan's unification of the three states of Satsuma, Osumi, and Hyuga.
There are stairs and slopes throughout the area, but please take a break and take a walk.

The view is very good. There is a bronze statue of Marshal Heihachiro Togo, and I often hear that some people come to pay their respects when ships of the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force or the Japan Coast Guard enter the port. There is also a shrine in the same park. Getting in and out of the park is a little difficult.

A beautiful beach that seems rarely visited. Over 2 hours, there were only 4 other people who came by. It is a bit off the beaten path and a little hard to find. There is space to park up to about a half dozen cars. But the real draw is that there is a slight sulphur smell in some areas, and the sand looks dark and wet, even above the waterline. The reason is that volcanic hot spring water is flowing from Sakurajima through the sand and into the sea. This makes the ocean water warmer than expected near the beach, and also means you can dig into the sand near the waterline (at low tide) to make yourself a natural, mini for onsen. How awesome is that? If you need a shovel and directions, the visitor center gift shop on the west coast sells mini shovels and has a driving map.

A hidden gem in Sakurajima. During low tide, you can dig black sand and acquire your own pool. It's a warm water like onsen. This area is mostly empty and I haven't seen any other people for an hour. Only hawks.
Beautiful views!

Is it because the hot water comes out in different places depending on the high tide?Other people were digging in different places.I was thinking of giving up and going home, but I saw steam coming from the shore, so I touched it and it was hot, so I found hot water as I dug. The river is currently under construction, but after asking the guide, you can go there for now. There is no parking lot, but there is a space where you can park several cars.

Let's take a shovel. The volcanic stones are all over the place and difficult to dig, but it might be possible to do it if it's about the same level as a footbath. As of March 2024, it is currently under construction, but you can enter on Sundays. There is no particular parking lot, but about 5 cars can be parked under the large bridge.

data.name: Karafune Ravine Park.(Kyōda spring water pond.)

reviews.text: Very beautiful place.

Carp, trout, and sturgeon swim in the pond of Tosenkyo Kyoda Spring Water, which was selected as one of the top 100 waters of the Heisei era. On the sidewalks around the pond, an umbrella sky event was held where colorful umbrellas were hung overhead.

It was raining today, so I thought it would be empty, but there were a lot of people with the same idea, which was surprising. 😂As far as Tosenkyo is concerned, the weather doesn't seem to have much to do with it.

It's cool and the sweet noodle soup is absolutely delicious ✨
I arrived late, so I was able to eat at Kirakira✨. I was lucky
It has a consistent taste no matter when you go, and it's perfect for cooling off in the summer, so I go there every month.

The tour to 明治藏 Soju and 津貫 Whiskey distilleries was truly amazing. The tour guide and docents were professional and explained every detail of how to make Soju and Whiskey, as well as the history diligently. The service was thorough and attentive. We enjoyed the interaction with the guide in the tour and the tasting session a lot.

It makes our trip in Kagoshima a memorable one which far beyond our expectations. We wouldn’t have such unforgettable experience if we hadn’t join the tour. If you are looking for a deep and meaningful tour, you should definitely check this out!

Joined TABITTO shochu distillery tour this weekend. Impeccable organization and very knowledgeable guide. Distillery rep took us around the place explaining production steps in detail taking his time to answer all question. Not the superficial kind of visit to rush you to the factory outlet. TABITTO guide was clearly very familiar with the place and the subject matter. Interpretation was great (and absolutely needed). Fair amount of free tasting afterwards at the store with helpful comments on aroma and flavors by shop manager/staff (?). Tour service was as promoted on website. TABITTO also introduced a place to eat and sample some more shochu in the evening. In all, a great introduction to shochu kagoshima style. thanks a lot.

Tabitto is more than a regular agency.

My family and I made reservations for a experience is a Shochu and Whiskey distilleries, tea ceremony and city highlight experience all the products were very well designed and very interesting.

Yoshiko helped us to communicate with the master of the tea ceremony and helped us to understand the meaning of each of the steps which are part of the tea preparation and tasting.

While my family and I were on our wat to the shochu and whiskey  distillery visits I commented to our guide Kanako that my mother in law family originally came from Makurasaki (the distilleries are located in such area) but we have losted contact with them and didn't know where to start looking for them.

Kanako san and Fujii san (our driver for the day) offered to take us to take a look at the area. Kanako san went further than that, she asked to two local ladies about my mother in law lastname and they took as to another neighbor that could help us. At the end, we were able to meet with our lost relative, it was very moving and heart warming.

Tabitto cares about their job but also really care about the persons that take their tours. They make a connection.

I definetely recommend their service.

We fell in love with Kagoshima all their treasures and people.

I get to participate in the Ohara festival thanks to TABITTO Travel! It was a really great experience being part of the dance group and immerse in this tradition that has more than 70 year history! Yoshie, who was the organizer and the guide for the tour, is a very friendly and attentive lady. She made sure that everyone was having fun and well taken care of throughout the event. I thoroughly enjoyed the whole tour and will definitely come back for their other tour experience! Do look out for their interesting tour experience when you come to Kagoshima!

The trip was fantastic. The tour guide took us to a more remote area to start the tour. The views were breath-taking. This is the best way to appreciate the surrounding nature and wildlife.
The tour guides were amazing! Assisted us with English, provided some interesting facts and overall they were all lovely and helpful.
Would definitely do it again. Really, really recommend!!!
Specializing in goods combining Kagoshima dialect and adorable illustrations, the store offers a variety of T-shirts, caps, and other items that make valuable souvenirs.

Just before I went on a trip to Kagoshima, I read about this restaurant in the newspaper and thought I had to go, so I immediately looked up the location of the restaurant on a map.
It is located about 5 minutes walk from Kagoshima Chuo Station. It's easy to understand. Interesting appearance. I was the only one when I visited.
As soon as I stepped into the store, my heart was captured! I wanted them all, I wanted to buy up the whole store. All of them have designs that will make you laugh. The size description for the T-shirts is also something you don't see at other stores. There was also stationery, so I bought a lot for myself and for my friends. The store clerk spoke the Kagoshima dialect that was written on the T-shirt, and I was like, "Huh? Huh?" and he told me the story of Sakurajima's ashes, so I had a great time apart from shopping. .
It was great to be able to take a closer look at the items! When I left the store, a group of 5 to 7 people had entered the store.
Well, it was fun! If you are going to Kagoshima, please stop by!

I stopped by when my wife and I were on a trip to Kagoshima.
It was my hope that she was my wife.
You'll understand when you go, but it's really fun.
The designs on the Pochibukuro are things like ``all assets'' and ``bribe.''
Items that have the spirit of gags all over them.
I couldn't help but buy a T-shirt on impulse.
Please try it once.

I saw it at the airport, but I walked to the back of the central station thinking there were definitely more shops there, and found that there were hundreds of times more products, and the interior was more like a fashionable izakaya than a T-shirt shop. There are lanterns and a carved wooden statue of Don Saigo's beloved dog to welcome you. Going to this store is a sightseeing trip in itself!
I followed the strategy of "don't be stingy and just take pictures", and while the female customers wanted to take pictures of every single one of them, I took twice as many pictures.

You should go there because you can enjoy cute things like hats that you can't find at the airport!

[7/8 (Friday)_08_Kagomania_The unique design is nice]

7/8 (Friday). The couple's four-day trip to Kagoshima and three-day trip to Miyazaki starts today.

I checked in to Kagoshima Sun Royal Hotel, where I would be staying today, and entered my room at 5:26 p.m.
I thought I wouldn't be able to catch the shuttle bus to Kagoshima city in time, so I thought I'd have no choice but to kill time by soaking in a hot spring, but...
When I said to my wife, ``There's a shuttle bus at 5:30 p.m.,'' she said, ``Let's get on!''
I called the front desk and asked if I could wait a little while, and they said "NO." I dashed out with my luggage and boarded the bus.
We boarded the train at 17:29 and left exactly at 17:30, so there was no lost time.
Thanks to my wife, everything went well. “This is definitely better,” said my wife. That is correct.

Due to the Friday evening rush, we arrived safely at Kagoshima Chuo Station, although it was already past the scheduled time of 17:42.

We took a commemorative photo with the ``Young Satsuma Statue'' in front of the station and headed to Kagomania. It's nice to be near the station, 500m 6 minutes.
My wife, who doesn't buy things, wanted to go there, which is unusual, and it seems like it caught the attention of my wife, who likes unique designs.

Perhaps because it was a weekday evening, we were the only customers. ``Can I take pictures inside the store?'' ``Yes,'' I said.
There are many unique designs such as Saigo-san and shochu, which are nice. I bought four items.
Wife: Baripa Kagomania Oi no Drinkata BAG2 (black) 990 yen
Wife: Kagomania Kagoshima Yokayoka handkerchief (white) 660 yen
Wife: Baripa Kagomania Waigaoini (T-shirt) (Ladies M) 2,750 yen
Me: Baripa Kagomania Saigodon (T-shirt) (Men's M) 2,750 yen
Total: 7,150 yen

Me: “How long has the store been closed?”
Manager: “About eight years ago.”
Me: “You can only buy it here.”
Manager: “Yes, we sell some products at the store in front of the station, but this is the only place where we have them all. We do not sell them online.”
However, when I looked online later, I found that the main product was being sold on Rakuten Mail Order's Yamagata-ya website.

data.formatted_address: Higashi Sengoku Chu, 17-19 Higashisengokuchō, Kagoshima, 892-0842, Japan
data.name: KAGOWA Kagoshima Tours & Activities

reviews.text: Beautiful and peaceful gardens. We loved visiting these gardens and learning more about Japanese culture. A lovely area to go and worth the drive from Kagoshima. We went as a family and everyone from my children to my father enjoyed our time here.
The meticulously kept property and gardens along with the history made this tour unique.  Learning about the Samurai was very interesting.
The surrounding parks are just as beautiful as the core residential area. It's an amazing place to experience if you are in Kagoshima, ticket to the karesansui gardens is 530 yen
Fascinating look at a samurai village. Having a guide really made a difference in understanding the gardens and how/why they are designed and constructed.

Fantastic piece of history as everything has stayed in place since they were built, the English signs were full of great information about each house and garden, you can use the QR code to listen to it but no need to waste time, just enjoy being there. Conned into paying to “go inside” when it’s so quiet that nobody would notice but they say staff need to see the ticket at each garden but also it’s just to see the garden and not inside the houses, they’re just for storage now.

data.formatted_address: Japan, 〒892-0848 Kagoshima, Hiranochō, 10−２１ コンフォート ビラ 高見馬場
data.name: 九州島々桜島発．輝き

reviews.text: The best place for souvenirs! They have unique items which are not sold at the airport or major shops. The selection is super nice and cool.
Sells souvenirs all from kagoshima. Try “miki”, a popular fermented rice and sweet potato drink from Okinawa/amami oshima. Unique but very very tasty.
Good place to shop for local products. Price wise I think is not expensive as I see locals buying from the shoo as well
Great variety cheap price for groceries and suvenir shopping

The first floor has many foods, sweets, and miscellaneous goods, and the second floor is dedicated to shochu. There is a wide variety of alcoholic beverages, and if you ask us about your favorite flavor, the staff will recommend a delicious shochu. We will arrange a courier service so you can go home empty-handed without having to worry about your luggage. For reference, if you purchase six bottles of shochu and ship it to the Chubu region, the shipping fee will only be around 1,100 yen. You can buy as many as you want with confidence. I came here on my last trip to Kagoshima, and I will come again next time.

This is the main wholesale fish market for Kagoshima. You can visit with a tour guide and you cannot buy seafood since it is reserved for licensed buyers. There are a few restaurants at the market so at least you can taste some seafood. There is plenty of parking near by. It’s a nice visit with the guide.
I joined the tour to the fish market. The guides were kind and helpful. It was a wonderful experience.

After this you can walk to dolphin port, and take the ferry to sakurajima
The fish market had three restaurants to choose them ... Sashimi was very reasonably priced ! Very fresh ... But if you want gourmet, this is not the place
English and Japanese language tours guide is available on pervious booking.
Cannot go inside for buying seafood, but the restaurant next to it has some very fresh and decent seafood to eat.
Fresh, local and seasonable vegetables. They also sell fresh fish and meat! The freshest vegetables and fruits I’ve found yet and at a very good price point!
I love this place! Fresh, locally-grown, seasonal vegetables and produce.
Well stocked with fresh food.
Perfect place to buy fresh vegetables and fruits. Good quality for good prices and quantities. You can buy all fresh greens there.

It seems to be a JA directly managed store. I was surprised when I entered. The vegetable corner includes cabbage, sweet potatoes, broccoli, carrots, tomatoes, green peppers, Chinese cabbage, taro, and more. The Chinese cabbage was a good deal on this day. The fruit corner seems to have a lot of mandarin oranges and tankan this season. Tankan is Shun. The meat corner had many types of beef, pork, and chicken. It had been cut into pieces. It can be used for various purposes. The chicken sashimi is also recommended. There was also a flower corner. I think there are quite a few different types of flowers. There were also plenty of fish cakes, rice, and tea. The bento corner also had a lot of variety. There are also events held on the weekends. You can find them all over JA, such as Ibusuki, Minamisatsuma, Aira, and Hioki in Kagoshima, so you can get a variety of specialty products. Shops you want to visit during the season
The hot spring stream food are special. Worth a try. Sweet potato is popular in Kagoshima. Rice cake is tasty but red bean bun is so-so.
Just a small foot spa with a souvenir shop. There are two restaurants there but closes at 17:00. Meanwhile, there is still two or three choices outside the market.
Cute location with food cooked in onsen water. The pork chop place on the first floor is good
Small market with a grocery store and a few restaurants. You can also take a foot bath and get some onsen steamed food.
You can relax in the footbath.  The price is also reasonable.  It is only one coin Japanese yen.

data.name: Sun Life Park Kagoshima Furusato Bussankan

reviews.text: Came here for the chicken for Christmas, didn’t disappoint, very tasty. Occasionally come here for other meat products for BBQ
Just another local souvenir store

This is a product store run by A Co-op that sells fish, meat, vegetables, fruits, fresh flowers, boxed lunches, side dishes, souvenirs, and more.
Especially when it comes to fish, there is a wide selection of sashimi, processed products, live fish, nigiri sushi, seafood bowls, etc. I was really spoiled for choice.
Apparently they sometimes have sashimi of fish that I'm not familiar with, but I was disappointed that they didn't have it this time.
There were sashimi of flying fish, flatfish, grunt, sea bream, porgies, and sailfish.
75,000 yen was also swimming.
There was also soft serve ice cream at the entrance, and the Japanese style soft serve was delicious!

A large A Co-op + cafeteria + souvenir shop + Zabon ramen + convenience store + α. The parking lot is large and can accommodate large vehicles.
There are a variety of Kagoshima souvenirs available, but the location is halfway there, and the items on display are things you can normally get at any Kagoshima souvenir shop, so it doesn't really feel special.
Fresh seafood is abundant. I'm really grateful that there is a branch of Zabon Ramen in addition to the cafeteria.

I stopped by while sightseeing in Ibusuki.

Seafood is abundant.
The sashimi was thick and had a nice texture and no odor at all.

It was a minor fish, not a member of the yellowtail family, but a member of the yellowtail family, and looked somewhere between yellowtail and Spanish mackerel, but it was delicious (⁠^⁠^⁠)
It was an unexpected bargain!
